key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices matched Thai Airways' site in 84.17% of cases last week, demonstrating strong alignment.
MSE offered lower prices than Thai Airways' site in 91.74% of itineraries, showcasing a competitive edge.
GDS prices matched with Thai Airways' site 76.32% of the time, indicating substantial consistency.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions, OTA and Thai Airways' site prices match 84.17% of the time for the latest week, showing a strong consistency in price alignment between the two channels.
The frequency of OTA offering lower prices than the airline site increased by 2.85% compared to last month, indicating a number of potentially competitive deals on the OTA.
OTA continues to list prices higher than the airline's site with a 0.95% weekly frequency increase, suggesting some markup on specific itineraries.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Prices were the same between the OTA and the airline's website 84.17% of the time in the last week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_title: Lower Prices on OTA Trending Up
ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The percentage of OTA lower prices instances grew by 2.85% compared to the previous month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes have high pricing alignment, with 82.93% of prices matching last week.
Long haul routes show a significant alignment change with a -2.99% frequency decrease in match from the previous week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In Thailand, 92.44% of itineraries had the same pricing on OTA and the airline's site.
Non-TH origin prices were lower on OTA 21.98% of the time last week, though this reflects a decline of 4.90% from the previous week.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed a high OTA lower price incidence at 9.82% last week, complemented by a 5.03% monthly increase.
Far out bookings saw a high alignment with the airline's site, sharing the same prices 92.05% of the time last week.

mse_highlights.line_content: For the airline's recent week, MSE showed lower prices than the airline's website in 91.74% of analyzed itineraries, indicating a strong competitive offering on this channel.
The frequency of cases where MSE pricing was higher than the airline's website slightly increased by 0.24% compared to the previous month, suggesting a minor variability in these occurrences.
There is a significant drop of 20.09% in the frequency of matches where MSE prices were the same as the airline's site over the past month, highlighting increased price differentiation.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances where the airline website offer was not found on MSE decreased by 0.21% month-over-month.
MSE pricing was lower than the airline's website by 20.06% more often compared to the previous month, showing increased aggressiveness in pricing strategy.

mse_summary_by_region.line_title: Short Haul MSE Lower Pricing Dominance
mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul, MSE channel offers lower prices 91.60% in the latest week with an increase of 23.18% compared to the previous month, emphasizing MSE as a leading price-driver for short haul.

mse_summary_by_region.line_title: Long Haul Stability on MSE Higher Pricing
mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE shows higher prices than the airline's website in 4.55% cases, with a slight increase of 3.01% over the past month for long haul, indicating relatively stable pricing strategy.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Thailand-origin itineraries, 91.62% of the prices on MSE were lower compared to the airline's site, and this increased by 25.79% over the past month, highlighting a competitive push in this market.
Non-Thailand departures maintained consistency with MSE's 91.21% lower pricing frequency, decreasing slightly by 4.25% month-over-month.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE's lower prices are significant for close-in bookings at 93.68% frequency, increasing by 21.77% compared to last month, which showcases MSE's strong attraction for last-minute travelers.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_title: Far-Out Bookings and MSE Pricing Advantage
mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: The MSE channel's lower pricing for far-out bookings was recorded in 88.00% of cases, an increase of 16.29% from the previous month, indicating aggressive early ticket purchasing strategies.

gds_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions, there is a negligible presence of GDS-only offers that are not available on the airline's website, indicating consistent product offerings between channels.
Over the last week, 76.32% of GDS pricing matched the airline's site, showing substantial consistency between channels.
GDS channel offered lower pricing than the airline website 13.79% of the time last week, notably boosting its competitive appeal.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The GDS consistently presents the same prices as the airline website in 76.32% of instances, strengthening customer trust in the airline's pricing strategy.
Only 9.89% of GDS prices are higher than on the airline site, reflecting a minor risk of channel-based price inflation.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul routes, GDS pricing is lower than the airline's website 15.72% of the time, encouraging regional travel bookings through this channel.
GDS pricing for long-haul routes aligns closely with the airline's website, with a high match rate of 84.85%, indicating stable pricing practices.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating from Thailand, GDS pricing is lower 10.72% of the time, supporting competitive local destination pricing strategies.
Non-Thailand origins manifest a higher likelihood of GDS being the cheaper option, with 25.27% of routes priced lower than the airline site.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking windows demonstrate a tendency towards GDS lower pricing in 16.55% of instances, appealing to last-minute travelers.
For far-out bookings, GDS prices prevail as lower 8.61% of the time, presenting a moderate competitive advantage for early planners.
